meanings.definition: To make neat, stylish, or attractive in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She spiffed up her room before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: The tailor spiffed up the suit for the special occasion.
meanings.sent3: The magician spiffed up his hat with a colorful feather.
meanings.sent4: The artist spiffed up the painting with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The gardener spiffed up the garden with fresh flowers.

meanings.definition: To give a boost or improvement to.
meanings.sent1: He spiffed his resume to impress the employer.
meanings.sent2: The chef spiffed up the dish with a secret ingredient.
meanings.sent3: The coach spiffed up the team's strategy for the big game.
meanings.sent4: The teacher spiffed up the lesson with interactive activities.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic spiffed up the car's engine for better performance.
